title: Former Liverpool manager Beard dies aged 47
byline: Former Liverpool manager Matt Beard has died at the age of 47, the Women’s Super League club has announced.

title: Hridoy and Hassan steer Bangladesh past Sri Lanka at Asia Cup
byline: Half-centuries by Towhid Hridoy (58) and Saif Hassan (61) powered Bangladesh to an exciting four-wicket win in the Super Four stage of the Asia Cup against former champions Sri Lanka in Dubai on Saturday.

title: Body of elderly woman found hanging from tree in Watawala
byline: Watawala Police this morning recovered the body of a 62-year-old woman found hanging from a tree in her estate.

title: Medicine shortage due to procurement delays, not finances: Health Minister
byline: The ongoing shortage of medicines in the country is the result of procurement delays and not financial difficulties, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Committee appointed to probe Pettah fire
byline: A committee has been appointed to investigate the fire that broke out at an electrical appliance store on 1st Cross Street, Pettah yesterday. The committee is headed by Deputy Minister of Public Security, Attorney-at-Law Sunil Watagala.

title: India warns new US fee for H-1B visa will have ’humanitarian consequences’
byline: The Indian government has said a new $100,000 (£74,000) fee for applicants seeking US skilled worker visas will have ’’humanitarian consequences’’.

title: Heathrow braces for second day of disruption after cyber-attack
byline: Air travellers are facing another day of disruption at several European airports including Heathrow, after a cyber-attack knocked out a check-in and baggage system.

title: Govt. mulls ending extra charges on debit and credit card payments
byline: The Ministry of Digital Economy said that steps are underway to abolish additional charges imposed on debit and credit card payments.

title: UK PM Starmer to recognise Palestinian statehood before UNGA meeting
byline: More than 100 years after the Balfour Declaration backed “the establishment in Palestine of a national home for the Jewish people”, and 77 years after the creation of Israel in the British Mandate of Palestine, the United Kingdom is set to formally recognise a Palestinian state.

title: SLTB to recruit women with air hostess-level uniforms
byline: Women will soon join the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) as drivers and conductors, dressed in newly designed uniforms at air hostess level, Transport Minister Bimal Rathnayake said.

title: Wasp attack injures 13 in Kotiyagala
byline: Thirteen plantation workers, including twelve women and one man, were hospitalised following a wasp attack at the Kotiyagala Tea Estate in Bogwantalawa yesterday (20).

title: President Dissanayake to leave for USA tomorrow
byline: resident Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to depart for the United States tomorrow (22) night to participate in the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman passes away at 47
byline: Mahil Munasinghe, Chairman of the Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha, passed away today (21) following a sudden illness. He reportedly fell ill this morning while engaging in physical fitness activities and was admitted to Karandeniya Hospital, where he later died.

title: Committee reveals misuse of Rs. 8 billion at Central Cultural Fund
byline: Over Rs. 8 billion has reportedly been misused without the approval of the Board of Governors of the Central Cultural Fund (CCF), according to Deputy Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs Gamagedara Dissanayake.
